t: Oppressed by the Wicked but Rejoicing in the Lord
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
Hear*pn my voice, O God, in my meditation; Preserve*ld my life from fear of the enemy.
Hide*ld me from the secret plots of the wicked, From*ld the rebellion of the workers of iniquity,
Who*ld sharpen their tongue like a sword, And*ld bend their*i bows*i to*i shoot*i their arrows—bitter words,
That*ld they may shoot in secret at the blameless; Suddenly*ld they shoot at him and do not fear.
They*ln encourage themselves in*i an evil matter; They*ld talk of laying snares secretly; They*ld say, “Who will see them?”
They*ld devise iniquities: “We*ld have perfected a shrewd scheme.” Both*ld the inward thought and the heart of man are deep.
But*ln God shall shoot at them with*i an arrow; Suddenly*ld they shall be wounded.
So*ld He will make them stumble over their own tongue; All*ld who see them shall flee away.
All*ld men shall fear, And*ld shall declare the work of God; For*ld they shall wisely consider His doing.
The*ln righteous shall be glad in the Lord,*s and trust in Him. And*ld all the upright in heart shall glory.
